summary: Frontend DriverDashboardPage was updated to defensively render eligible orders (loading/error/empty/table) and to handle multiple OrderStatus variants via __kind__. Backend/main.mo diff is truncated and does not show any Orders data model or required order APIs, so core backend requirements cannot be verified as implemented.

missing_requirements.requirement: Implement backend Orders persistence and expose createOrder/getMyOrders/getOrder/listEligibleDriverOrders/listAllOrders/updateOrderStatus with consistent OrderId generation, totalAmount computation, timestamps, status filtering, and required authorization patterns.
missing_requirements.reason: The backend/main.mo diff excerpt only shows type/import declarations and is truncated before any Orders storage or the required public methods. There is no visible evidence that the required order APIs, persistence, filtering (eligible == status.__kind__ === 'purchased'), totalAmount computation, or admin/auth enforcement were implemented.

hallucinated_features.description: Driver dashboard status badge logic includes additional status kinds beyond the explicitly required 'purchased' eligible status (pending/assigned/ready/inDelivery/delivered/cancelled) and displays user-facing labels for them.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-2 only requires rendering eligible orders and a status badge based on returned status shape; it does not request adding UI support for non-eligible lifecycle statuses (and REQ non-goals explicitly exclude accept/deliver workflows).
